key_points: "Cuomo Prime Time" had its lowest-rated week of the year from April 5 to April 9, averaging 1.2 million viewers.
The show is down 45 percent in viewership compared to the week of Jan. 25.
The drop in viewership coincides with scandals involving Chris Cuomo's brother, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo.
Chris Cuomo reportedly received prioritized coronavirus testing by his brother's administration.
Gov. Andrew Cuomo has been accused of sexual harassment by multiple women and covering up nursing home COVID-19 deaths.
CNN previously allowed Chris Cuomo to interview his brother in a series widely criticized for lacking seriousness.
Following the scandals, CNN announced Chris Cuomo would no longer cover his brother on the show.
"Cuomo Prime Time" saw a 55 percent decline in viewership among adults age 25-54.
Fox News' "Gutfeld!" outperformed every CNN program since its premiere on April 5.
"Gutfeld!" also surpassed several broadcast network late-night shows in viewership.
